name: Braze modules
title: Braze modules

children.text: After connecting to the Braze app, you can use the following modules to build your
Create or update a user profile
Creates or updates attributes, events or purchases for a user profile given its Braze ID, external ID or user alias.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Select the action that you want to perform in this module.
Select whether you want to update profiles or create new ones.
Enter a user ID in your Braze account.
If you have a use ID in your Braze account, you may not specify a user external ID, user alias, email, or phone number.
If you have an external user ID, you may not specify a user Braze ID, user alias, email, or phone number.
Enter a user alias label and name.
If you have a user alias, you may not specify a user Braze ID, user external ID, email, or phone number.
If you have a user's email, you may not specify a user Braze ID, user external ID, user alias, or phone number.
If you have a user's phone number, you may not specify a user Braze ID, user external ID, user alias, or email.
Enter desired values to the user attributes fields.
Select the attributes view to define custom attributes. The
shows all the attributes as they are in your Braze account. The
Enter desired values to the custom attributes fields. Displayed fields are automatically loaded from your Braze account.
Enter desired values to the event attributes fields.
Enter desired values to the purchase attributes fields.
Gets a list of all catalogs.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Set the Maximum number of results Make will return during one execution cycle.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter the name for a new catalog.
Enter the description for a new catalog.
Enter or map the following information:
Enter the name for an item.
Select or map the type of an item.
Deletes a catalog given its name.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter or map the name of the catalog that you want to delete.
Gets a list of items inside a given catalog.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter or map the name of the catalog which items you want to list.
Set the Maximum number of teams Make will return during one execution cycle.
Gets a catalog item given its ID.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter or map the name of the catalog which item you want to get.
Enter or map the ID of the item that you want to get.
Create or update a catalog item
Creates or updates a catalog item given its ID.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Select the action that you want to perform in this module.
Enter or map the name of the catalog where you want to create or update an item.
Enter the name for a new catalog or a catalog that you want to update.
Enter desired values to the item fields. Displayed fields are automatically loaded from your Braze account.
Deletes a catalog item given its ID.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter or map the name of the catalog which item you want to delete.
Enter or map the name of the item that you want to delete.
Sends a message from a given campaign.

data.label: Braze
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Braze account

children.text: Enter the ID of the campaign from which you want to send a message.
Select if you want to send a message to an entire segment that a canvas targets.
, you cannot include a recipients list.
Enter an external user ID.  If you have an external user ID, you may not specify a user alias or email.
: Enter a user alias label and name.  If you have a user alias, you may not specify an external user ID or email.
: Enter a user email.  If you have a user email, you may not specify an external user ID or user alias.
: Select or map an option for prioritizing the most recently updated user.  Refer to Braze API documentation to learn more.

: Select or map the canvas properties entries view to define canvas entry properties. The Simplified View allows setting up trigger properties one by one. The Advanced View uses a JSON string.  Refer to Braze API documentation to learn more.
: Enter a key and value for each canvas entry property.  Refer to Braze API documentation to learn more.
: Select or map whether you want to send a message to existing recipients only.  If you set it as no, you cannot use a user alias, and you must use custom attributes.
: Select or map the attributes view to define custom attributes. The Simplified View shows all the attributes as they are in your Braze account. The Advanced View uses a JSON string.
: Enter desired values of the custom attributes fields. Displayed fields are automatically loaded from your Braze account.

Enter the URL of the file you want to attach to your message.

: Enter a key and value for each canvas entry property.  Refer to Braze API documentation to learn more.
: Select or map whether you want to send a message to existing recipients only.  If you set it as no, you cannot use a user alias, and you must use custom attributes.
: Select or map the attributes view to define custom attributes. The Simplified View shows all the attributes as they are in your Braze account. The Advanced View uses a JSON string.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
